alert.note: Alert for Elkhead and Park Mountains; Upper Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 2:27PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Routt County through 300 PM MDT... At 226 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Yampa, or 43 miles southeast of Craig, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Routt County. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 137 and 151. Colorado 131 between mile markers 50 and 52, and between mile markers 61 and 67. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Elkhead and Park Mountains; Upper Yampa River Basin
